item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. 8 months of OCaml after 8 years of Haskell in production (2023) (70 points | 31 comments)
2. Lessons I learned working at an art gallery (13 points | 2 comments)
3. Show HN: Copper – Open-source robotics in Rust with deterministic log replay (62 points | 14 comments)
4. Fish have a brain microbiome – could humans have one too? (206 points | 83 comments)
5. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (December 2024) (248 points | 211 comments)
6. Accelerated AI Inference via Dynamic Execution Methods (32 points | discuss)
7. World Labs: Generate 3D worlds from a single image (318 points | 111 comments)
8. Bioluminescent wood using the white rot fungus desarmillaria tabescens (87 points | 16 comments)
9. Show HN: Open-sourced (road) traffic counting application (45 points | 8 comments)
10. Optimality of Gerver's Sofa (78 points | 16 comments)
11. .NET Support on Heroku (44 points | 26 comments)
12. Evidence of the use of silk by Bronze Age civilization (118 points | 43 comments)
13. A better approach to gravity: how we made EGM2008 faster (41 points | 12 comments)
14. Every board game rulebook is awful [pdf] (205 points | 194 comments)
15. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (December 2024) (97 points | 199 comments)
16. A Collection of Kaleidoscope Schemes, Sourced from the WayBack Machine. (16 points | 3 comments)
17. Intel announces retirement of Pat Gelsinger (773 points | 620 comments)
18. Unlocking the power of time-series data with multimodal models (91 points | 20 comments)
19. Show HN: Flow – A dynamic task engine for building AI agents (68 points | 21 comments)
20. Ethiopian wolves reported to feed on nectar (32 points | 12 comments)
21. Murderbot, she wrote (180 points | 130 comments)
22. Kenya and "the decline of the greatest coffee" (2021) (166 points | 137 comments)
23. The world of Dante's Divine Comedy (57 points | 34 comments)
24. Teaching quantum physics in schools: Experts encourage focus on 2 state systems (6 points | 2 comments)
25. Show HN: SeekStorm – open-source sub-millisecond search in Rust (143 points | 35 comments)
26. Facebook's Little Red Book (372 points | 183 comments)
27. Show HN: Automate your studio – mute a mixer channel to turn your PTZ camera (50 points | 15 comments)
28. The Sperry Rand Corporation (54 points | 26 comments)
29. The zoology and biochemistry of xenomorphs from the Alien franchise (101 points | 64 comments)
30. KlongPy: High-Performance Array Programming in Python (107 points | 61 comments)
